bugs.description: The method `matchesSelector` in `Element.ts` assumes that `this.node` is always defined. However, the constructor allows `node` to be `undefined`, and in such cases accessing `node.matches` or `node.getAttribute` will throw a TypeError at runtime when `addStylesFromStyleDefinition` invokes `matchesSelector`. The method should first check whether `node` is truthy before referencing its properties (e.g., `if (!node) return false;`).
